page.title: 12World War II Find, Hailey
page.content: On the land-cover survey I stubbed my foot on a fragment of metal. I dug up what I thought was an ordinary shot- gun cartridge. I sanded it down and on the top it read ST 1942 20mm. which was in the Second World War. At school I showed Mr. Claridge, who lived in Hailey in 1942. He told me a story about a formation of Avro Ansons which were night training from RAF Finstock, circling, landing and taking off again. A German fighter attacked so they turned the runway lights off. The pilots training couldn't find the run way so the German fighter could easily shoot them down. Some of the pilots tried to land and crashed in doing so. Perhapes my cartrige came from the guns of the German fighter plane.
